definitions.definition: a white crystalline substance that gives seawater its characteristic taste and is used for seasoning or preserving food.
examples: sodium chloride, table salt, NaCl the potatoes need salt

definitions.definition: something that adds freshness or piquancy.
examples: he described danger as the salt of pleasure
synonyms: punch "he added salt to the conversation"

definitions.definition: any chemical compound formed from the reaction of an acid with a base, with all or part of the hydrogen of the acid replaced by a metal or other cation.

examples: cook the carrots in boiling salted water
there was good talk to salt the occasion

definitions.definition: sprinkle (a road or path) with salt in order to melt snow or ice.
fraudulently make (a mine) appear to be a paying one by placing rich ore in it.
(of a horse) having developed a resistance to disease by surviving it.
